name: NPR
text: More than 400 public health and criminal justice experts penned a letter to the CDC urging its immunization advisory committee to vaccinate incarcerated people alongside those in long-term care facilities. https://t.co/yHOPaEvThb @WHYYNews

name: NPR
text:
The vaccine helped eradicate polio, made his father world famous, and shaped Peter Salk's own life — he also became a doctor of infectious diseases.

He's following the vaccine news closely and has been hugely impressed by recent developments. https://t.co/Mpt16gtgX0

name: NPR
text: The irony of Nipsey Hussle's untimely death sheds light on the larger backdrop of inequality in his hood: mass supervision in Black communities. @LouderThanARiot reports on Nipsey Hussle, the LAPD And the inescapable trap of gang affiliation. https://t.co/0EjjEJ7AKD

name: NPR
text: The oldest ice on Earth probably is hiding somewhere in Antarctica, because this frozen continent holds ice that's hundreds of thousands and even millions of years old. Scientists are hoping to find it. https://t.co/1SclV8qDtd

name: NPR
text: U.S. tourists aren't welcome in most countries around the world because of the high number of coronavirus cases surging in the United States. But at least one country is keeping its borders open: Mexico. https://t.co/QCyHfeDjfR

name: NPR
text:
Amid the coronavirus pandemic, people around the world are celebrating a Christmas unlike any other.

Here's what celebrations looked like from around the world. https://t.co/GGZdKQfHh1

name: NPR
text: Surfing is a hallmark of Southern California's famous beaches. But soon, people who live in the desert east of Los Angeles will be able to take to the waves themselves without driving to the shore. https://t.co/SnXmv6uZZt

name: NPR
text: Decades before openly gay Americans were legally allowed to serve in the military, Joseph Patton, a gay man, served in silence. He was given an undesirable discharge for being friends with two men who told commanders they were lovers. https://t.co/TIzANKGYPw

name: NPR
text:
Willy Solis never saw himself as an activist. "I'm an introvert, extreme introvert," he said. "That's my nature."

But 2020 changed that — like so many other things. https://t.co/TLgpvgYjUE

name: NPR
text: Experts in infectious diseases, virology and food safety share their tips about how you can go stock up on food and toiletries without picking up the coronavirus. https://t.co/PDEdZPKkBW

name: NPR
text:
We really do live on a beautiful planet with beautiful people – check out these photo award winners. 

A contest spokeswoman said they make her “nostalgic” for the pre-pandemic world. https://t.co/LXr7Ziq03x
